intro: Wormskioldia lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wormskioldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its fleshy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it blooms during the cooler months. Wormskioldia lanceolata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
